data.comment: The match is underway at SeatGeek Stadium.
New England are caught offside.
In the minute 2, In Bridgeview, Chicago push forward quickly but are pulled up for offside.
Goal! The away team take a 0-1 lead through Teal Bunbury.
Tommy McNamara instrumental with a fine assist.
In the minute 7, Robert Sibiga signals a throw-in for Chicago, close to New England's area.
Throw-in Chicago.
Robert Sibiga signals a free kick to Chicago in their own half.
In the minute 15, Corner awarded to Chicago.
Gaston Gimenez (Chicago) gets up for a header but cannot keep the ball on target.
Goal kick for New England at SeatGeek Stadium.
In the minute 16, Throw-in for Chicago at SeatGeek Stadium.
Chicago are too eager and fall into an offside trap.
Ball safe as New England is awarded a throw-in in their half.
In the minute 20, New England drive forward at breakneck speed but are pulled up for offside.
Chicago have been awarded a corner by Robert Sibiga.
Goal! Fabian Herbers equalizes to bring the score to 1-1.
In the minute 22, That's a fine assist from Miguel Navarro.
In Bridgeview a free kick has been awarded the away team.
Throw-in for New England close to the penalty box.
In the minute 25, New England have been awarded a corner by Robert Sibiga.
Adam Buksa for New England gets in a strike but fails to hit the target.
Robert Sibiga awards Chicago a goal kick.
In the minute 28, Can New England get the ball into an attacking position from this throw-in in Chicago's half?
It's a goal kick for the away team in Bridgeview.
Chicago awarded a free kick in their own half.
In the minute 31, Robert Sibiga awards the away team a throw-in.
Free kick for New England in their own half.
Chicago awarded a throw-in in their own half.
In the minute 34, New England have a goal kick.
Throw-in high up the field for Chicago in Bridgeview.
Diego Fagundez for New England has been booked by Robert Sibiga and receives a first yellow card.
In the minute 37, Throw-in for Chicago in their own half.
Ball goes out of play for a Chicago goal kick.
A throw-in for the away team on the opposite half.
In the minute 40, New England have a goal kick.
Ball safe as Chicago is awarded a throw-in in their half.
Can New England capitalize from this throw-in deep inside Chicago's half?
In the minute 43, Robert Sibiga signals a free kick to New England.
Chicago pushes forward through Alvaro Medran, whose finish on goal is saved.
Robert Sibiga signals a New England throw-in in Chicago's half.
In the minute 45, Throw-in for Chicago in the half of New England.
Chicago to take a throw-in in New England territory.
The 1st half is prolonged by 1 minutes of added time.
In the minute 45, Goal kick for New England at SeatGeek Stadium.
The first-half is over.
The second-half has just kicked-off.
Chicago's Elliot Collier gets his shot away but it misses the target.
Robert Sibiga awards New England a goal kick.
In the minute 46, New England make their first substitution with Henry Kessler replacing Antonio Delamea Mlinar.
In the minute 47, It's a goal kick for the home team in Bridgeview.
New England will need to be alert as they defend a dangerous free kick from Chicago.
Boris Sekulic (Chicago) is first to the ball but his header is off-target.
In the minute 50, Ball goes out of play for a New England goal kick.
Corner awarded to Chicago.
Goal kick for New England at SeatGeek Stadium.
In the minute 54, Goal! Teal Bunbury gives New England a 1-2 lead in Bridgeview.
Great play from Alex Buttner to set up the goal.
Throw-in for Chicago at SeatGeek Stadium.
Free kick for New England in the half of Chicago.
In the minute 57, Bruce Arena (New England) is making a second substitution, with Cristian Penilla replacing Tommy McNamara.
Robert Sibiga awards the home team a throw-in.
In the minute 58, Ball goes out of play for a Chicago goal kick.
Matt Polster is writhing in pain and play has been suspended for a few moments.
Robert Beric is replacing Fabian Herbers for Chicago at SeatGeek Stadium.
In the minute 61, Throw-in for Chicago in the half of New England.
New England needs to be cautious. Chicago have an attacking throw-in.
Robert Sibiga signals a free kick to Chicago just outside New England's area.
In the minute 64, Chicago drives forward and Alvaro Medran gets in a shot. Without netting, however.
Chicago have been awarded a corner by Robert Sibiga.
Chicago are pushing forward but Ignacio Aliseda's finish is wide of the goal.
In the minute 64, New England have a goal kick.
Matt Polster is back on his feet again.
New England to take a throw-in in Chicago territory.
In the minute 66, Free kick for Chicago in their own half.
Corner awarded to Chicago.
Robert Sibiga awards New England a goal kick.
In the minute 69, The home team replace Elliot Collier with Djordje Mihailovic.
Bruce Arena is making the team's third substitution at SeatGeek Stadium with Scott Caldwell replacing Diego Fagundez.
Chicago have a dangerous throw-in.
In the minute 74, Miguel Navarro of Chicago gets in a strike, but is off target.
It's a goal kick for the away team in Bridgeview.
Throw-in high up the field for Chicago in Bridgeview.
In the minute 76, Przemyslaw Frankowski (Chicago) gets in a header on goal but the attempt is cleared.
New England needs to be cautious. Chicago have an attacking throw-in.
The away team have replaced Adam Buksa with Tajon Buchanan. This is the fourth substitution made today by Bruce Arena.
Free kick Chicago.
In the minute 78, Kelyn Rowe is replacing Matt Polster for New England at SeatGeek Stadium.
Can Chicago get the ball into an attacking position from this throw-in in New England's half?
In the minute 80, Chicago have a dangerous throw-in.
Goal kick for New England at SeatGeek Stadium.
It's getting dangerous! Free kick for New England close to the penalty box.
In the minute 83, New England have been awarded a corner by Robert Sibiga.
Corner awarded to New England.
Throw-in for Chicago in their own half.
In the minute 84, Can Chicago capitalize from this throw-in deep inside New England's half?
Throw-in Chicago.
A throw-in for the away team on the opposite half.
In the minute 87, Chicago awarded a throw-in in their own half.
Ball goes out of play for a New England goal kick.
Throw-in for New England at SeatGeek Stadium.
In the minute 89, Robert Sibiga signals a Chicago throw-in in New England's half.
Raphael Wicky is making the team's third substitution at SeatGeek Stadium with Brian Gutierrez replacing Alvaro Medran.
Robert Sibiga signals a free kick to Chicago in their own half.
Throw-in for Chicago in the half of New England.
The fourth official's board shows 4 minutes, which will be added to the 2nd half.
Robert Sibiga signals a throw-in for Chicago, close to New England's area.
It's 1-2 as the referee blows for full-time.
The home team have replaced Przemyslaw Frankowski with Jonathan Bornstein. This is the fourth substitution made today by Raphael Wicky.
